alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 3:10PM CDT until May 06 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following county, Monroe. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 410 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Madisonville, Vonore, Greenback, Tellico Plains, Tariffville, McGee Carson Peninsula, Fort Loudon State Park, Mount Vernon, Citico Beach and Great Smoky Mountains National Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
